subject: Philosophy
title: Musonius Rufus: The Roman Socrates
description: Learn Musonius Rufus: The Roman Socrates in one minute.

hook.text: Musonius Rufus was called the 'Roman Socrates.' He was exiled twice and kept teaching anyway.

buildup.text: He taught Epictetus and argued philosophy must be lived, not just discussed in classrooms.

discovery.text: Uniquely for his era, he insisted women deserve the same philosophical education as men.

twist.text: He also advocated vegetarianism and simple living â€” radical positions in luxury-loving Rome.

climax.text: His ideas were ahead of his time by centuries, but they flowed naturally from Stoic principles.

punchline.text: Philosophy isn't what you say. It's what you do.

quiz.question: What was unusual about Musonius Rufus's views for his era?
options: He believed women deserved equal education
